meanings.definition: Part of food that a ruminant animal regurgitates to chew again.
meanings.sent1: The cow chewed her cud slowly under the shade of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The sheep happily munched on its cud in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The goat accidentally dropped its cud, making the other animals laugh.
meanings.sent4: The idea sat in his mind like a cud, waiting to be chewed over.
meanings.sent5: The cud tasted of sweet grass and memories of the field.

meanings.definition: A portion of tobacco held in the mouth and chewed.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa always had a cud of tobacco in his cheek.
meanings.sent2: The old cowboy spat out his cud before entering the saloon.
meanings.sent3: The kids wrinkled their noses at the smell of the tobacco cud.
meanings.sent4: The cud of tobacco stained his teeth a deep brown.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the tobacco cud lingered in the air.

meanings.sent1: The cow will cud contentedly in the barn.
meanings.sent2: After grazing, the sheep will cud for hours.
meanings.sent3: He cudded on the problem, hoping for a solution to pop up.
meanings.sent4: She cudded over the decision, weighing the pros and cons.
meanings.sent5: Cudding on the idea helped him see it from different angles.
